intro: Limonium linifolium var. linifolium, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes or along the seashore. Its flowers are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Limonium linifolium var. linifolium is widely cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
